Key Match Events: Angel Di Maria scored the only goal of the match in the 40th minute.
Lionel Messi made his return to international football after a six-month hamstring injury, coming on in the 56th minute.
Di Maria's goal was his second consecutive goal in an international match, tying him with Gonzalo Higuain for the fifth-most goals in Argentina's history.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina head coach Lionel Scaloni decided to sit Messi for the first half to ensure he arrives in optimal conditions for the Copa America.
Scaloni emphasized the importance of playing against a high-level rival like Ecuador to prepare for the Copa America.
Post-Match Reflections: Scaloni praised the team's competitive spirit and highlighted the importance of continuing to compete at their best.
Scaloni mentioned the goal of competing well in the Copa America and the upcoming qualifiers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina has not lost in their last seven meetings with Ecuador, a streak dating back to 2019.
Di Maria's 31st goal for Argentina places him just four goals behind Diego Maradona on the country's all-time leaderboard.
